TERMS AND CONDITIONS
Effective: 07/15/2022
Please read these Terms and Conditions carefully before using our Service.
DEFINITIONS
The following definitions have the same meaning regardless of whether they appear in singular or plural or in other grammatical forms:
Account
means a unique account created for you to access our Service or parts of our Service.
Application
means the software program provided by Smile downloaded by you on any electronic device to place your Orders.
Customer
means a Merchant’s customer.
Smile
(also referred as "we") refers to SmilePOS LLC, a Washington limited liability company.
Feedback
means feedback, innovations or suggestions sent by you regarding the attributes, performance or features of our Service.
Products
refer to food, beverages and other items, which are listed on a Merchant’s menu and offered for sale on the Service.
Merchant
means a restaurant or other business that has signed an agreement or agreements with Smile for Smile’s POS systems and their features and related services.
Order
means a request by you to purchase Products through the Service.
Privacy Policy
means the terms which set out, on
https://www.smilepos.com/privacy.html
, how Smile will deal with personal information received from you via our websites and/or for the Service.
Payment Method
means a method of your payment, such as your credit or debit card or other permitted payment method, for your Order.
Payment Transaction
means a transaction of your payment to Merchants for your Order with an eligible Payment Method.
Service
refers to our services available through any websites, including
https://www.smiledining.com
, Application, digital ordering features, or any other ways Smile allows you to engage with us for your Orders directly or through a Merchant that uses Smile.
Terms and Conditions
(also referred as "Terms") mean these Terms and Conditions that form the entire agreement between you and Smile regarding the use of the Service.
You
(in upper or lower case) means an individual accessing or using the Service or a legal entity on behalf of which such individual is accessing or using the Service, as applicable.
ACKNOWLEDGEMENT
These are the Terms and Conditions governing the use of the Service and the agreement that operates between you and Smile.  Your access to and use of the Service is conditioned on your acceptance of and compliance with these Terms and Conditions.  These Terms and Conditions apply to all visitors, users and others who access or use the Service.
By accessing or using the Service, you agree to be bound by these Terms and Conditions.  If you disagree with any part of these Terms and Conditions, then you may not access the Service.  Smile reserves the right in our sole discretion to revise and update these Terms and Conditions from time to time.  Any such changes or modifications will be effective immediately upon posting of the revisions on our website(s), and your continued use of Service after such time will constitute your acceptance of such changes or modifications.  If you do not agree with the changes or modifications, you can cancel your Account with us by contacting
[email protected]
.  You should from time to time review the Terms and any policies and documents incorporated in them to understand the terms and conditions that apply to your use of the Service.
You represent that you are at least 18 years of age and legally capable of entering into binding contracts.  If you are an entity, organization, or company, the individual accepting the Terms on your behalf represents and warrants that he or she has the authority to bind you and you agree to be bound by the Terms.  Notwithstanding the above, for placing Orders for alcohol beverages, you must be sufficient legal age for such Orders.
You authorize Smile to process your Order through the Payment Method on behalf of the Merchant from which you ordered.
Your access to and use of the Service is also conditioned on your acceptance of and compliance with our Privacy Policy.  Our Privacy Policy describes our policies and procedures on handling personal information, including without limitation, the collection, use, storage, processing, modification, disclosure, and deletion of your personal information, when you use the Service.  Please read our Privacy Policy carefully before using our Service.
MERCHANTS
Smile provides technology services to Merchants to enable Customers to place Orders, facilitates Orders with Merchants, and processes Payment Transactions on behalf of each Merchant.
Orders and Payment Transactions you make through our Service are transactions between you and the Merchant only, not with Smile or any of our affiliates.  Smile is not the seller of any product or service offered by Merchants and is not a party to any Payment Transaction facilitated through the Service.
You hereby acknowledge and understand that each Merchant is solely responsible and liable for all aspects of its own day-to-day operations and all selling, pricing, packaging, and provision of any products or services offered to its Customers through the Service.  Smile makes no representation or warranty regarding whether a Merchant holds any applicable permit, license, registration, or other credential for its business, whether representations by a Merchant are true and accurate, or whether a Merchant complies with applicable law.  Smile is not responsible for the quality of the products or services provided by Merchants.
USER ACCOUNTS
When you use the Service, you can choose whether you would like to register and create an Account.  If you create an Account, you may save your personal information to make future Orders faster and easier.  You may place Orders without creating an Account, but you will not be able to save any personal information or preferences for future Orders.
When you create an Account, you must provide us information that is accurate, complete, and current at all times.  Failure to do so constitutes a breach of the Terms, which may result in immediate termination of your Account.
You are responsible for safeguarding your login information that you use to access the Service and for any activities or actions under your login information.  You agree not to disclose your login information to any third party.  You must notify us immediately upon becoming aware of any breach of security or unauthorized use of your Account.
APPLICATION
The Application enables you to place Orders with Merchants.  In order to use the Application, you must download the Application to your device.  Smile does not warrant that the Application will be compatible with your device.  You may use data in connection with the Application and incur additional charges from your wireless provider for the Service.  You agree that you are solely responsible for such charges.  Smile hereby grants you a non-exclusive, non-transferable, revocable license to use the Application for one Account on a device owned or leased by you, for your personal use.
PLACING ORDERS FOR PRODUCTS
Your Information
If you wish to place an Order for Products available on the Service, you may be asked to supply certain information relevant to your Order, including, without limitation, your name, email, phone number, credit card number, credit card expiration date, your billing address, and delivery information.
You represent and warrant that: (i) you have the legal right to use any credit or debit card(s) or other payment method(s) in connection with your Order; and that (ii) the information you supply to us is true, correct and complete.  By submitting such information, you grant us the right to provide the information to payment processing third parties for purposes of facilitating the completion of your Order.
Order
Smile makes available the Service and, either directly or through a third-party service provider, processes your Payment Transactions for your Orders on behalf of Merchants through the payment networks.  When you make an Order, you authorize Smile, as agent for the Merchant, to submit the charge in the amount of the Order (including any gratuities, fees and taxes) to your Payment Method issuer as well as any credits in connection with chargebacks, reversals, refunds or adjustments.  Smile, as the agent of the Merchant, will assist the Merchant in submitting the Payment Transaction to the payment network and processing the Payment Transaction.  Upon either Smile or a third-party service provider receiving the proceeds of the transaction, your payment obligation to the Merchant will be deemed completed (except in the case of a later chargeback or reversal).
You must provide a valid Payment Method to pay for your Order made through any of the Service.  You authorize Smile to confirm your Payment Method is in good standing with the issuing financial institution.  You agree that Smile, on behalf of the Merchant, may resubmit a Payment Transaction for processing to a payment network in the event a prior Payment Transaction was declined or returned.
If you choose to store Payment Method information with Smile via the Service for your convenience and use in future transactions, you agree that Smile may receive up-to-date information on your Payment Method information (such as card number or expiration date) through services available from the card networks and may update your Payment Method credentials stored with Smile (if you choose to store your Payment Method credentials) from time to time.
We may establish limitations concerning use of the Service, including without limitation, individual or aggregate transaction limits on the dollar amount or number of Payment Transactions you may make within certain time periods.  We may decline to process any Payment Transaction without any notice to you.  We may delay processing of or hold or cancel processing of any Payment Transaction upon the direction of the Merchant or if we believe, in our sole discretion, that the transaction is invalid, suspicious, involves misconduct or fraud, or otherwise violates applicable law and rules, these Terms and Conditions, or any other policies. Payments made through the Service are also subject to the terms of your agreement with your Payment Method issuer.  You are solely responsible for any charges or fees that may be imposed by your Payment Method issuer as a result of using the Service.
Order Changes, Cancellation, and Refunds
Merchants each set their own cancellation and refund policies.  Once an Order has been made through the Service, you will need to contact the Merchant directly to inquire if you can make a change to or cancel the Order or whether you may receive a refund.
You authorize Smile to communicate with the Merchant regarding the change or cancellation of your Order.  Reimbursement will be made upon confirmation by Smile that the change or cancellation of your Order can be made.  We will use the same means of payment as you used for the Order.
For questions or customer service regarding an Order or the product or service provided by a Merchant, please contact the Merchant directly.  Smile is not responsible for any Merchant product or service issues or content errors or inaccuracies related to a Merchant’s website, menu, or other materials.
Smile reserves the right to refuse or cancel your Order at any time for certain reasons, including the following:
There is an error in your Order.
Fraud or an unauthorized or illegal transaction is suspected.
Availability, Errors and Inaccuracies
Merchants may update their Products, including their prices, from time to time.  The Products available on our Service may be mispriced, described inaccurately, or unavailable, and we may experience delays in updating information regarding the Products on the Service and other websites.
Smile cannot and do not guarantee the accuracy or completeness of any information of the Products, including their prices, images, specifications and availability, and Merchants’ services.  We reserve the right to change or update information and to correct errors, inaccuracies, or omissions on the Service at any time without prior notice.
Payments
All Products purchased are subject to a one-time payment.  Payment can be made through various payment methods we have available, such as Visa and MasterCard.
Payment cards (credit cards or debit cards) are subject to validation checks and authorization by your card issuer.  If we do not receive the required authorization, we will not be liable for any delay or non-delivery of your Order.
Shipping and Delivery
Product shipping, delivery, and preparation timelines are estimated by each Merchant.  Merchants and their shipping or delivery service providers, where applicable, are responsible for ensuring that appropriate insurance policies are in place for the shipping and delivery of the Products to Customers.  Smile will not be responsible for any damage caused to Products during shipping or delivery or any loss or damage caused in connection with the supply of Products.
INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
The Service and its original contents (excluding contents provided by you or other users), features and functionality (including derivative works, modifications, and additions thereto) are and will remain the exclusive property of Smile and its licensors.  The Service is protected by copyright, trademark, and other applicable laws.
Our intellectual property, including copyright and trademark, may not be used in connection with any product or service without the prior written consent of Smile.
YOUR FEEDBACK TO US
You assign all rights, title and interest in any Feedback you provide Smile.  If for any reason such assignment is ineffective, you agree to grant Smile a non-exclusive, perpetual, irrevocable, royalty free, worldwide right and license to use, reproduce, disclose, sub-license, distribute, modify and exploit such Feedback without restriction.
LINKS TO OTHER WEBSITES
Our Service may contain links to third-party websites or services that are not owned or controlled by Smile.  Smile has no control over, and assumes no responsibility for, the content, privacy policies, or practices of any third-party websites or services.  You further acknowledge and agree that Smile shall not be responsible or liable, directly or indirectly, for any damage or loss caused or alleged to be caused by or in connection with the use of or reliance on any such content, goods or services available on or through any such websites or services.  We strongly advise you to read the terms and conditions and privacy policies of any third-party websites or services that you visit.
TERMINATION
We may limit, suspend, or terminate your Account immediately, without prior notice or liability, for any reason whatsoever, including without limitation, if you breach these Terms and Conditions.  Upon termination, your right to use the Service will cease immediately.  If you wish to terminate your Account, you may simply discontinue using the Service or send an email to
[email protected]
requesting to terminate your Account.
Termination of your Account does not relieve you of the obligation to pay for any Orders made as well as related fees and charges already incurred.  In the event of closure of your Account, we will not provide any refunds for amounts previously paid through the Service.
In certain cases, we may not allow you to close your Account, including but not limited to:
to evade an investigation;
you have open or pending Orders or Payment Transactions; or
if you owe money to Smile or a Merchant due to your use of the Service.
LIMITATION OF LIABILITY
Notwithstanding any damages that you might incur, the entire liability of Smile and any of its suppliers under any provision of these Terms and your exclusive remedy for all of the foregoing shall be limited to the amount actually paid by you through the Service.
To the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, in no event shall Smile or its suppliers be liable for any special, incidental, indirect, or consequential damages whatsoever (including, but not limited to, damages for loss of profits, loss of data or other information, or business interruption, arising out of or in any way related to the use of or inability to use the Service, third-party software, and/or third-party hardware used with the Service or otherwise in connection with any provision of these Terms), even if Smile or any supplier has been advised of the possibility of such damages and even if the remedy fails of its essential purpose.
Some jurisdictions do not allow the limitation of liability for certain kinds of damages, so some of these limitations may not apply to you.  In such a case, Smile's liability will be limited to the minimum amount enforceable under applicable law.
“AS IS” AND “AS AVAILABLE” DISCLAIMER
The Service is provided to you “AS IS” and “AS AVAILABLE” and with all faults and defects, if any, without warranty of any kind.  To the maximum extent permitted under applicable law, Smile, on its own behalf and on behalf of its respective licensors and service providers, expressly disclaims all warranties, whether express, implied, statutory or otherwise, with respect to the Service, including all implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, title and non-infringement, and warranties that may arise out of course of dealing, course of performance, usage or trade practice.  Without limitation to the foregoing, Smile provides no warranty or undertaking, and makes no representation of any kind that the Service will meet your requirements, achieve any intended results, be compatible or work with any other software, applications, systems or services, operate without interruption, meet any performance or reliability standards or be error free or that any errors or defects can or will be corrected.  Without limiting the foregoing, neither Smile nor any of Smile's provider makes any representation or warranty of any kind, express or implied: (i) as to the operation or availability of the Service, or the information, content, and materials or products included thereon; (ii) that the Service will be uninterrupted or error-free; (iii) as to the accuracy, reliability, or currency of any information or content provided through the Service; or (iv) that the Service, its servers, the content, or e-mails sent from or on behalf of Smile are free of malware or other harmful components.
Any material downloaded or otherwise obtained through the use of the Service is done at your own discretion and risk and you are solely responsible for any damage to your computer system or device or loss of data that results from the download of any such material.  No advice or information, whether oral or written, obtained by you from Smile or a third party through or from the Service will create any warranty not expressly stated in these Terms.
Some jurisdictions do not allow the exclusion of certain types of warranties or limitations on applicable statutory rights of a consumer, so some of the above exclusions or limitations may not apply to you.  In such a case, the exclusions and limitations set forth in this section shall be applied to the minimum extent required by law.
FORCE MAJEURE
Smile will not be liable for any failure or delay resulting from any condition beyond its reasonable control, including but not limited to governmental action or acts of terrorism, earthquake, fire, pandemic, flood or other acts of God, labor conditions, power failures, and Internet disturbances.
GOVERNING LAW
The laws of the State of Washington govern these Terms and your use of the Service without giving effect to any choice or conflict of law provision or rule that would cause the application of the laws of any other jurisdiction.
SEVERABILITY AND WAIVER
Severability

Waiver
Except as provided herein, the failure to exercise a right or to require performance of an obligation under these Terms shall not effect a party's ability to exercise such right or require such performance at any time thereafter nor shall the waiver of a breach constitute a waiver of any subsequent breach.
TRANSLATION INTERPRETATION
These Terms and Conditions may have been translated if we have made them available to you on our Service.  You agree that the original English text shall prevail in the case of a dispute.
CHANGES TO THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS
We reserve the right, at our sole discretion, to modify or replace these Terms at any time.  If a revision is material, we will make commercially reasonable efforts to provide, in a reasonable time and manner (including email), any new terms taking effect.  What constitutes a material change will be determined at our sole discretion.
By continuing to access or use our Service after those revisions become effective, you agree to be bound by the revised terms.  If you do not agree to the new terms, in whole or in part, please stop using our websites and the Service.
CONTACT US

Privacy Policy
Last modified: 02/22/2022
Introduction
SmilePOS, LLC ("
Company
" or "
We
") respect your privacy and are committed to protecting it through our compliance with this policy. We provide point of sales systems and related products and services (collectively "
Product
" or "
Products
") that help our restaurant customers better manage their business.
This policy describes the types of information we may collect from you or that you may provide when you visit the websites, Smilepos.com and SmileDining.com (collectively, "
Websites
") or through our Products and our practices for collecting, using, maintaining, protecting, and disclosing that information.
This policy applies to information we collect:
On the Websites.
In email, text, and other electronic messages between you and the Websites.
Through mobile and desktop applications you download from the Websites, which provide dedicated non-browser-based interaction between you and the Websites.
through our Products used or accessed by us or our Product users.
It does not apply to:
information collected by us offline or through any other means not described in this policy;
information collected by any third party, including through any application or content (including advertising) that may link to or be accessible from the Websites or Products; or
Any third-party websites, products, or services (including those of Product users and their vendors) even if they link to our Websites or Products, and we encourage you to review the applicable privacy policy of those third parties to learn how your information will be collected and used.
Please read this policy carefully to understand our policies and practices regarding your information and how we will treat it. If you do not agree with our policies and practices, your choice is not to use our Websites or Products. By accessing or using the Websites or Products, you agree to this privacy policy. This policy may change from time to time (see Changes to Our Privacy Policy). Your continued use of the Websites or Products after we make changes is deemed to be acceptance of those changes, so please check the policy periodically for updates.
Information We Collect About You and How We Collect It
We collect several types of information from and about users of our Websites and Products (including users of our Websites and Products and customers of our Products users), including information:
By which you may be personally identified, such as name, postal address, e-mail address, telephone number (“
Personal Information
”);
About your internet connection, the equipment you use to access our Websites or Products, and usage details.
We collect this information:
Directly from you when you provide it to us.
Automatically as you navigate through the Websites. Information collected automatically may include usage details, IP addresses, and information collected through cookies, web beacons, and other tracking technologies.
From third parties, for example, our business partners.
Information You Provide to Us
The information we collect on or through our Websites and Products may include:
Information that you provide by filling in forms on our Websites or provided by our Product users. This includes information provided at the time of registering to use our Websites or Product user’s merchandise, subscribing to our Products, or requesting further Products. We may also ask you for information when you report a problem with our Websites or Products, including, without limitation:
Records and copies of your correspondence (including email addresses) if you contact us.
Your responses to surveys for research purposes.
Details of transactions you carry out through our Websites or Products and of the fulfillment of your orders. You may be required to provide financial information before placing an order through our Websites or Products.
Your search queries on the Websites.
Information We Collect Through Automatic Data Collection Technologies
As you navigate through and interact with our Websites, we may use automatic data collection technologies to collect certain information about your equipment, browsing actions, and patterns, including:
Details of your visits to our Websites, including traffic data, location data, logs, and other communication data and the resources that you access and use on the Websites.
Information about your computer and internet connection, including your IP address, operating system, and browser type.
The information we collect automatically does not include Personal Information. It helps us to improve our Websites and to deliver a better and more personalized service, including by enabling us to:
Estimate our audience size and usage patterns.
Store information about your preferences, allowing us to customize our Websites according to your individual interests.
Speed up your searches.
Recognize you when you return to our Websites.
The technologies we use for this automatic data collection may include:
Cookies (or browser cookies).
A cookie is a small file placed on the hard drive of your computer. You may refuse to accept browser cookies by activating the appropriate setting on your browser. However, if you select this setting you may be unable to access certain parts of our Websites. Unless you have adjusted your browser setting so that it will refuse cookies, our system will issue cookies when you direct your browser to our Websites.
Flash Cookies.
Certain features of our Websites may use local stored objects (or Flash cookies) to collect and store information about your preferences and navigation to, from, and on our Websites. Flash cookies are not managed by the same browser settings as are used for browser cookies. For information about managing your privacy and security settings for Flash cookies, see Choices About How We Use and Disclose Your Information.
Web Beacons.
Pages of the Websites and our e-mails may contain small electronic files known as web beacons (also referred to as clear gifs, pixel tags, and single-pixel gifs) that permit the Company, for example, to count users who have visited those pages or opened an email and for other related website statistics (for example, recording the popularity of certain website content and verifying system and server integrity).
Children Under the Age of 13
Our Websites or Products are not intended for children under 13 years of age. No one under age 13 may provide any information to the Websites or Products. We do not knowingly collect Personal Information from children under 13. If you are under 13, do not use or provide any information on the Websites or through our Products. If we learn we have collected or received Personal Information from a child under 13 without verification of parental consent, we will delete that information. If you believe we might have any information from or about a child under 13, please contact us at
[email protected]
.
How We Use Your Information
We use information that we collect about you or that you provide to us, including any Personal Information:
To present our Websites and its contents to you.
To provide you with information or Products that you request from us.
To fulfill any other purpose for which you provide it.
To provide you with notices about your account/subscription, including expiration and renewal notices.
To carry out our obligations and enforce our rights arising from any contracts entered between you and us, including for billing and collection.
To notify you about changes to our Websites or any Products we offer or provide though it.
To allow you to participate in interactive features on our Websites.
In any other way we may describe when you provide the information.
For any other purpose with your consent.
We may also use your information to contact you about our Products and third-parties' goods and services that may be of interest to you. If you do not want us to use your information in this way, or if you want to change your information with us, adjust your user preferences or change your information in your account profile, or contact us as stated in Contact Information.  You may also delete your information by clicking the delete button in your account profile or contacting us as stated in Contact Information.  For more information, see Choices About How We Use and Disclose Your Information and Contact Information.
Disclosure of Your Information
We may disclose aggregated information about our users and information that does not identify any individual, without restriction.
We may disclose Personal Information that we collect, or you provide as described in this privacy policy:
To our subsidiaries and affiliates.
To contractors, service providers, and other third parties we use to support our business and who are bound by contractual obligations to keep Personal Information confidential and use it only for the purposes for which we disclose it to them.
To a buyer or other successor in the event of a merger, divestiture, restructuring, reorganization, dissolution, or other sale or transfer of some or all of Company’s assets, whether as a going concern or as part of bankruptcy, liquidation, or similar proceeding, in which Personal Information held by Company about our Websites and Product users is among the assets transferred.
For any other purpose disclosed by us when you provide the information.
With your consent.
We may also disclose your Personal Information:
To comply with any court order, law, or legal process, including to respond to any government or regulatory request.
To enforce or apply our terms of use and other agreements, including for billing and collection purposes.
If we believe disclosure is necessary or appropriate to protect the rights, property, or safety of the Company, our customers, or others. This includes exchanging information with other companies and organizations for the purposes of fraud protection and credit risk reduction.
Choices About How We Use and Disclose Your Information
We strive to provide you with choices regarding the Personal Information you provide to us. We have created mechanisms to provide you with the following control over your information:
Tracking Technologies and Advertising.
You can set your browser to refuse all or some browser cookies, or to alert you when cookies are being sent. To learn how you can manage your Flash cookie settings, visit the Flash player settings page on Adobe's website. If you disable or refuse cookies, please note that some parts of this site may then be inaccessible or not function properly.
Data Security
Unfortunately, the transmission of information via the internet is not completely secure. Although we do our best to protect your Personal Information, we cannot guarantee the security of your Personal Information transmitted to our Websites or through our Products. Any transmission of Personal Information is at your own risk. We are not responsible for circumvention of any privacy settings or security measures contained on the Websites or the Products.
Changes to Our Privacy Policy
It is our policy to post any changes we make to our privacy policy on this page. If we make material changes to how we treat our users' Personal Information, we will notify you by email to the email address specified in your account or through a notice on the Websites. The date the privacy policy was last revised is identified at the top of the page. You are responsible for ensuring we have an up- to-date active and deliverable email address for you, and for periodically visiting our Websites and this privacy policy to check for any changes.
Contact Information
To ask questions or comment about this privacy policy and our privacy practices, contact us at:
SmilePOS, LLC, PO Box 2653, Lynnwood, WA 98036 or
[email protected]
.
Accessibility Statement
SmilePOS LLC (“SmilePOS,” “we,” “our,” or “us”) is committed to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities.  We are continually improving the user experience for everyone, and applying the relevant accessibility standards.
Measures to Support Accessibility
SmilePOS takes the following measures to ensure accessibility of Smile Dining website:
Incorporate accessibility considerations into our digital resource design process.
Ensures accessibility is part of our continuous improvement process.
Follow reasonable technical practices for digital accessibility.
Conformance Status
The Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG)
defines requirements for designers and developers to improve accessibility for people with disabilities.  It defines three levels of conformance: Level A, Level AA, and Level AAA.  Smile Dining website is conformant with WCAG 2.0 level AA and partially conformant with WCAG 2.1 level AA.   Partially conformant means that some parts of the content do not fully conform to the accessibility standard.
Feedback
We welcome your feedback on the accessibility of Smile Dining website.  Please let us know if you encounter accessibility barriers:
Phone: (206) 905-9025
E-mail:
[email protected]
Compatibility with Browsers and Assistive Technology
Smile Dining website is designed to be compatible with assistive technologies and the last two versions of major browsers, including Chrome, Microsoft Edge, Safari, and Firefox.
In Internet Explorer 10, 11, and older browsers, some aspects of the website may not display optimally.  Smile Dining website is not designed for Internet Explorer 9 and earlier versions.
Technical Specifications
Accessibility of Smile Dining website relies on the following technologies to work with the particular combination of web browser and any assistive technologies or plugins installed on your computer:
HTML
CSS
JavaScript
SVG
These technologies are relied upon for conformance with the accessibility standards used.
Limitations and Alternatives
Despite our best efforts to ensure accessibility of Smile Dining website, there may be some limitations.  Please contact us as described in “Feedback” above if you encounter any issues in accessing our website.
Assessment Approach
SmilePOS assessed the accessibility of Smile Dining website by self-evaluation.
Formal complaints
If you wish to send us a formal complaint regarding accessibility accommodations of this website, please contact us as described in “Feedback” above.
Formal Approval of this Accessibility Statement
This Accessibility Statement is approved by:
SmilePOS LLC

PRIVACY STATEMENT
SECTION 1 - WHAT DO WE DO WITH YOUR INFORMATION?
When you purchase something from our store, as part of the buying and selling process, we collect the personal information you give us such as your name, address and email address.
        When you browse our store, we also automatically receive your computer’s internet protocol (IP) address in order to provide us with information that
        helps us learn about your browser and operating system.
        Email marketing (if applicable): With your permission, we may send you emails about our store, new products and other updates.
SECTION 2 - CONSENT
How do you get my consent?
When you provide us with personal information to complete a transaction, verify your credit card, place an order, arrange for a delivery or return a
        purchase, we imply that you consent to our collecting it and using it for that specific reason only.
        If we ask for your personal information for a secondary reason, like marketing, we will either ask you directly for your expressed consent, or provide
        you with an opportunity to say no.
        If after you opt-in, you change your mind, you may withdraw your consent for us to contact you, for the continued collection, use or disclosure of your
        ontinued collection, use or disclosure of your information, at anytime, by contacting us at
[email protected]
SECTION 3 - DISCLOSURE
We may disclose your personal information if we are required by law to do so or if you violate our Terms of Service.
SECTION 4 – Smile POS
Our store is hosted on Smile POS, LLC. They provide us with the online e-commerce platform that allows us to sell our products and services to you.
        Your data is stored through Smile POS’ data storage, databases and the general Smile POS application. They store your data on a secure server behind a firewall.

        Payment:

        Smile POS stores your credit card data. It is encrypted through the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI-DSS). Your purchase transaction data is stored only as long as is necessary to complete your purchase transaction. After that is complete, your purchase transaction information is deleted.
        All direct payment gateways adhere to the standards set by PCI-DSS as managed by the PCI Security Standards Council, which is a joint effort of brands like Visa, MasterCard, American Express and Discover.
        PCI-DSS requirements help ensure the secure handling of credit card information by our store and its service providers
SECTION 5 - THIRD-PARTY SERVICES
In general, the third-party providers used by us will only collect, use and disclose your information to the extent necessary to allow them to perform the services they provide to us.
        However, certain third-party service providers, such as payment gateways and other payment transaction processors, have their own privacy policies in respect to the information we are required to provide to them for your purchase-related transactions.
        For these providers, we recommend that you read their privacy policies so you can understand the manner in which your personal information will be handled by these providers.
        In particular, remember that certain providers may be located in or have facilities that are located a different jurisdiction than either you or us. So if you elect to proceed with a transaction that involves the services of a third-party service provider, then your information may become subject to the laws of the jurisdiction(s) in which that service provider or its facilities are located.
        As an example, if you are located in Canada and your transaction is processed by a payment gateway located in the United States, then your personal information used in completing that transaction may be subject to disclosure under United States legislation, including the Patriot Act.
        Once you leave our store’s website or are redirected to a third-party website or application, you are no longer governed by this Privacy Policy or our website’s Terms of Service.
Links:
        When you click on links on our store, they may direct you away from our site. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of other sites and encourage you to read their privacy statements.
SECTION 6 - SECURITY
To protect your personal information, we take reasonable precautions and follow industry best practices to make sure it is not inappropriately lost, misused, accessed, disclosed, altered or destroyed.
        If you provide us with your credit card information, the information is encrypted using secure socket layer technology (SSL) and stored with a AES-256 encryption. Although no method of transmission over the Internet or electronic storage is 100% secure, we follow all PCI-DSS requirements and implement additional generally accepted industry standards.
SECTION 7 - AGE OF CONSENT
By using this site, you represent that you are at least the age of majority in your state or province of residence, or that you are the age of majority in your state or province of residence and you have given us your consent to allow any of your minor dependents to use this site.
SECTION 8 - CHANGES TO THIS PRIVACY POLICY
We reserve the right to modify this privacy policy at any time, so please review it frequently. Changes and clarifications will take effect immediately upon their posting on the website. If we make material changes to this policy, we will notify you here that it has been updated, so that you are aware of what information we collect, how we use it, and under what circumstances, if any, we use and/or disclose it.
        If our store is acquired or merged with another company, your information may be transferred to the new owners so that we may continue to sell products to you.
QUESTIONS AND CONTACT INFORMATION
If you would like to: access, correct, amend or delete any personal information we have about you, register a complaint, or simply want more information contact our Privacy Compliance Officer at
[email protected]
Last updated on 15 March 2017

menu — Thai Peacock

menu

Catering
family
menu
special menu
LARB CRISPY ROLLS-
crispy rolls stuffed with spiced minced chicken, toasted rice powder, glass noodles, cabbage, and carrots with mild spicy tamarind dipping sauce (Nam Jim Jiew)  $10
GARLIC & BLACK PEPPER STIR-FRY (GF, VG)-
with your choice of ground chicken, sliced chicken, beef, pork, or tofu
, mushrooms, crushed seaweed, and onions, served over a bed of cabbage    $16+
TOM-YUM PAD HAANG-
stir fried version of the famous Tom-Yum soup with shrimp, squid, scallop and crispy trout, house mayonnaise, red bell, onions, mushroom, basil, side of rice    $28
house signature COCKTAILS
MONKEY KING-
medium spicy cocktail made with Hot Monkey Vodka and Crater Lake Vodka, red pear, lemongrass, coconut, palm sugar, lime    $12
THAI SUMMER BREEZE-
Thai Rum, lychee, coconut, lemongrass, lime   $12
*we use Bacardi spiced rum as a substitute when Mekhong Thai rum is not available..
thai-inspired CLASSIC cocktails
WHISKEY SMASH-
Four Roses, Aperol, basil, black pepper, citrus   $13
TAMARIND WHISKEY SOUR-
Four Roses, tamarind, five spices, citrus   $12
KIWI WHISKEY RICKEY-
Four Roses, cold-pressed Yuzu, kiwi   $12
BANGKOK MULE-
Thai way of Moscow Mule with Thai Rum (or substitute with Bacardi Spiced Rum), coconut & lemongrass infused sake, ginger beer, citrus   $12
LYCHEE DAIQUIRI–
Thai Rum (or substitute with Bacardi Spiced Rum), Lychee, Fresh Citrus · $12
MANGO STICKY RICE-
PIÑA COLADA-inspired with Thai Rum (or substitute with Bacardi Spiced Rum), Asian mango, coconut milk   $12
MANGO MARGARITA-
El Jimador, Asian mango, plum salt, citrus   $12
SPICY MANGO MARGARITA-
El Jimador, Asian mango, plum salt, hot sauce, citrus   $12
PALOMA-
El Jimador, basil, black pepper, grapefruit, citrus   $12
AVIATION-
Butterfly Pea infused Wild Root Gin (Oregon), Cream De Violet, citrus   $12
about salad rolls
SALAD ROLLS-
We are experiencing market shortage in
“Rice Paper Wrapper”
and will only be preparing
Salad Rolls
in limited quantity each day.  We apologize for the inconvenience if we run out in the mid day.
NOTE FOR GUEST
OUR MENU :
served individually or family style.  dishes are brought out as they are ready.
VG, GF, SF :
while many dishes are prepared accordingly, we share all cooking equipment.
COOKING OIL :
we use canola oil for stir-frying and use creamy soybean oil to deep-frying.
PARTY OF 6+ :
auto-gratuity 18%
will be added for ease of check splitting and tips calculation.

The information these cookies collect will not personally identify you, and they cannot track your browsing activity on non Controller’s websites.

A popular Thailand street food. A punch of flavors of Home-Style grill marinated quarter leg chicken on the open flame. Served with flavorful papaya salad, 2 styles of dipping sauce & yummy gooey sticky rice.
(Eat like a Thai boxer throwing an elbow
Holy Basil Wings (Forget About Your Ordinary Wings)   18.25
Deep-fried chicken wings tossed with holy basil garlic sauce, bell pepper, onion and crispy basil.
Served with jasmine rice
Home Made Grilled chicken Teriyaki Bowl   17.25
Grilled marinated chicken to perfection, broccoli, carrot,
Homemade teriyaki sauce.
Served with jasmine rice or yakisoba noo
Bangkok Beef Noodle   18.75
Stir-fried ground beef sirloin with onions, tomatoes, bell pepper, pea, carrot and yellow curry gravy sauce; served over pan-fried wide rice noodle with fried egg
Hoisin Baby Back Ribs   18.25
Grilled baby back ribs glazed with our house hoisin sauce, broccoli, drizzled with sriracha sauce. Served with jasmine rice
Gingery Chicken (Evan’s Favorite..To Die For)   18.25
Slow simmered quarter leg chicken with garlic, onion in savory gingery tomato based sauce. Served with jasmine rice, carrots & broccoli
Crazy Noodle   18.25
Stir-fried rice noodle with egg, ground chicken & shrimp, bean sprout,mushroom, scallion in famous Tom Yum Sauce
Eggplant Lover   18.25
Sautéed Chinese eggplant with ground chicken, garlic, bell peppers, fresh basil, soy bean paste and basil garlic sauce
Khao Rad Na Gai   17.75
Sauteed Chicken breast with mushroom, bamboo shoot, carrot in savory gravy soy sauce. Served with jasmine rice and fried egg
Chicken on Skewers (Gai Satay)   17.25
Grilled to perfection of marinated tender chicken breast on skewers with a mixture of coconut milk and Thai spices. Served with jasmine rice,cucumber salad (cucumber, onion, bell pepper) & popular Thai peanut dipping sauce
Chicken & Shrimp Crispy Basil   18.75
Sautéed ground chicken & shrimp, onion, bell pepper, mushroom, sweet basil leaves and chili sauce. Served with fried egg and Prik Nam Pla

Bottled Beer
– $7
Singha
A premium quality lager beer brewed from the finest ingredients with 100% Barley Malt and Saaz Hops. the highest quality hops in the world. Full-bodied and rich in taste, with strong hops character.
Tsing Tao
A well-hopped standard pale lager of 4.7% abv, is the flagship brew. The China's second largest brewery.
Sapporo
A Premium Beer is a refreshing lager with a crisp, refined flavor and a clean finish. Sapporo is the oldest beer brand in Japan.
Full Sail Amber Ale
A sweet, malty, medium-bodied ale with a spicy, floral hop finish. It's brewed with 2-row Pale, Crystal and Chocolate malts. And hop it with Mt. Hoods and Cascades. One of Oregonian Favorites since 1989.
Black Butte Porter
A dark beer as the first and flagship brand, Black Butte is produced in Deschutes . A slight hop bitterness up front enhances the distinctive chocolate and roasted finish. It's prized for its creamy mouthfeel and intense complex flavors.
Asahi
(Rice Lager) Sapporo, Japan - Dry and crisp rice lager makes for a refreshing light beer.
Level ‘s Sweep the Leg
(Rice Lager) Portland, Oregon - A session lager with a subtle tropical coconut hop character.
White Claw
(Hard Seltzer) Glendale, Arizona - The classic hard seltzer. Available in Mango or Black Cherry
Heineken (Non-Alcoholic)
(Lager) Netherlands - A gentle fruity flavor and slight malty notes with zero-alcohol.
Avid’s Dragon Fruit Cider
(Cider) Bend, Oregon - Sweet and fierce, this cider is balanced with raspberry and dragon fruit.

– 16oz/22oz $8/$10

House Cocktails
– $15
Siam Tea
A tropical delight of citrus vodka, rum, gin, and Triple Sec paired with house sweet and sour, raspberry liqueur, and fresh raspberries.
Mojito
Choice of four flavors: classic, lemongrass, mango or pineapple. Each is mixed with white rum, sugar, lime juice, soda water, and fresh mint.
One Night in Bangkok
A memorable Bangkok blend of smooth Bourbon whiskey, Thai iced coffee, and sweet cream.
Raspberry Lemon Drop
Your favorite lemon drop sweetened with fresh raspberry. Made with citrus vodka, Triple Sec, and served with a sugar rim.
Coconut Elixir
Muddled lime and coconut vodka, served up martini style.
House Martini
Our own Thai Bloom! version of the classic martini: Monopolowa vodka, paired with a spicy jalapeno olive.
Pineapple Express
An exotic cocktail combining the sweetness of coconut vodka, banana liqueur and pineapple juice.
Spicy Cosmo
A spicy Cosmo twist featuring vodka infused with lemongrass and Thai chili, served with a sweet sugar rim.
Thai Tea Kicker
A Thai Bloom! original cocktail features sweet vanilla vodka, almondy amaretto, Thai Iced Tea and whipped cream.
Manhattan
Thai Whiskey with sweet vermouth, freshly brewed Jasmine tea, and drops of bitters. Shaken cold and served up with a cherry garnish.
Mai Thai
Dark rum and coconut rum with grenadine, orange juice, pineapple juice with a peach schnapps float.
Cucumber Cocktail
A uniquely refreshing combination of gin, muddled lime, cucumber, and mint, shaken up cold.
Tamarind Margarita
Thai-style margarita with tamarind (a popular tropical fruit) mixed with tequila, Triple Sec, lime, and house sweet and sour. Served on the rocks with a sugar rim. Garnished with cinnamon and orange slice.
Mimosa
Korbel Prosecco with choice of orange or mango juice.

House Wine

House Plum Wine

Ponzi

Stoneleigh Sauvignon Blanc

Yellow pear and lemon oil with hints of toast, allspice and oak.
Alta Vista

Momokawa Sake

Willamette Valley
Pinot Noir - A medium-bodied silky texture, and a fruit - forward nose of ripe red cherry, raspberry and cranberry accented. A well balancing of acidity & vibrancy wine.
Charles Krug

King Estate

Willamette Valley
Riesling - Willamette Valley, OR. Balance of sweet and refreshing crispness with aromas of citrus and tropical fruits.
Willamette Valley
Pinot Gris - A bright medium-bodied profile, the wine is clean, crisp and refreshing from fresh pear, green apple and citrus accented by a hint of vanilla.
Seven Hills Cabernet Sauvignon
Walla Walla, WA - Medium body wine with firm tannins and balanced acidity
Seven Hills Merlot
Walla Walla, WA - Strawberry, black plum and spice with a juicy, firm finish.
After Dinner Cocktails
Death by Chocolate
The ultimate chocolate martini with vanilla vodka and Godiva White Chocolate Liqueur.
Salted Caramel Martini
Truly indulgent, enjoy real Ghirardelli Caramel shaken up with vanilla vodka. Served with a sweet & salty rim.
White Thai Affair
A Thai twist on a classic white russian, featuring our famed Mekhong Whisky and Cinnamon Vanilla Baileys.
Raspberry Béret
A decadent treat: Chambord, Kahlua, Frangelico, vanilla vodka, and raspberry purée with freshly brewed coffee. Whipped cream is optional but encouraged.
Hot Damn!!!
The name says it all. Our own spice-infused tom yum vodka with cinnamon liqueur, served chilled. Note: one spice level only, no adjustments may be made.
Beautiful
A perfectly beautiful blend of Hennessy and Grand Marnier. Served in a brandy sniffer with a fresh peel of orange.
Prices are subject to change without notice.

Sabye a new restaurant in Sherwood Oregon.
Sabye Thai Street Food opened up February 2019, inspired by street food in Thailand. Sabye specializing in bringing authentic Thai Street cuisine straight to your plate just how street venders in Thailand intended it to be.
We are hiring! If you are looking to join our kitchen team, please contact us. (Two years of Thai kitchen experience required.)

About the Business
Business owner information
Ae S.
Business Owner
We are a family owned restaurant that serves Lao food. One of the most tastiest cuisines out there. We keep our food very traditional. Ones with the bravest taste buds should definitely give us a try. Those that are almost that brave will need to experience it themselves.
…

A:
Not sure if there's much to choose from directly off the menu, since at the very least there's going to be fish sauce in nearly everything. You can always call and see if they'd accommodate.

, how Smile will deal with personal information received from you via our websites and/or for the Service.

means a transaction of your payment to Merchants for your Order with an eligible Payment Method.
Service
refers to our services available through any websites, including
https://www.smiledining.com
, Application, digital ordering features, or any other ways Smile allows you to engage with us for your Orders directly or through a Merchant that uses Smile.

(also referred as "Terms") mean these Terms and Conditions that form the entire agreement between you and Smile regarding the use of the Service.

(in upper or lower case) means an individual accessing or using the Service or a legal entity on behalf of which such individual is accessing or using the Service, as applicable.

MERCHANTS

Orders and Payment Transactions you make through our Service are transactions between you and the Merchant only, not with Smile or any of our affiliates. USER ACCOUNTS

You may place Orders without creating an Account, but you will not be able to save any personal information or preferences for future Orders.

Your Information

You represent and warrant that: (i) you have the legal right to use any credit or debit card(s) or other payment method(s) in connection with your Order; and that (ii) the information you supply to us is true, correct and complete.  By submitting such information, you grant us the right to provide the information to payment processing third parties for purposes of facilitating the completion of your Order.
Order
Smile makes available the Service and, either directly or through a third-party service provider, processes your Payment Transactions for your Orders on behalf of Merchants through the payment networks.  When you make an Order, you authorize Smile, as agent for the Merchant, to submit the charge in the amount of the Order (including any gratuities, fees and taxes) to your Payment Method issuer as well as any credits in connection with chargebacks, reversals, refunds or adjustments.  Smile, as the agent of the Merchant, will assist the Merchant in submitting the Payment Transaction to the payment network and processing the Payment Transaction.  Upon either Smile or a third-party service provider receiving the proceeds of the transaction, your payment obligation to the Merchant will be deemed completed (except in the case of a later chargeback or reversal).
You must provide a valid Payment Method to pay for your Order made through any of the Service.  You authorize Smile to confirm your Payment Method is in good standing with the issuing financial institution.  You agree that Smile, on behalf of the Merchant, may resubmit a Payment Transaction for processing to a payment network in the event a prior Payment Transaction was declined or returned.

Order Changes, Cancellation, and Refunds
Merchants each set their own cancellation and refund policies.  Once an Order has been made through the Service, you will need to contact the Merchant directly to inquire if you can make a change to or cancel the Order or whether you may receive a refund.
You authorize Smile to communicate with the Merchant regarding the change or cancellation of your Order.  Reimbursement will be made upon confirmation by Smile that the change or cancellation of your Order can be made.  We will use the same means of payment as you used for the Order.

Payments
All Products purchased are subject to a one-time payment.  Payment can be made through various payment methods we have available, such as Visa and MasterCard.
Payment cards (credit cards or debit cards) are subject to validation checks and authorization by your card issuer.  If we do not receive the required authorization, we will not be liable for any delay or non-delivery of your Order.
Shipping and Delivery
Product shipping, delivery, and preparation timelines are estimated by each Merchant.  Merchants and their shipping or delivery service providers, where applicable, are responsible for ensuring that appropriate insurance policies are in place for the shipping and delivery of the Products to Customers.  Smile will not be responsible for any damage caused to Products during shipping or delivery or any loss or damage caused in connection with the supply of Products.

Privacy Policy
Last modified: 02/22/2022
Introduction
SmilePOS, LLC ("
Company
" or "
We
") respect your privacy and are committed to protecting it through our compliance with this policy. We provide point of sales systems and related products and services (collectively "
Product
" or "
Products
") that help our restaurant customers better manage their business.
This policy describes the types of information we may collect from you or that you may provide when you visit the websites, Smilepos.com and SmileDining.com (collectively, "
Websites
") or through our Products and our practices for collecting, using, maintaining, protecting, and disclosing that information.
This policy applies to information we collect:
On the Websites.
In email, text, and other electronic messages between you and the Websites.
Through mobile and desktop applications you download from the Websites, which provide dedicated non-browser-based interaction between you and the Websites.
through our Products used or accessed by us or our Product users.
It does not apply to:
information collected by us offline or through any other means not described in this policy;
information collected by any third party, including through any application or content (including advertising) that may link to or be accessible from the Websites or Products; or
Any third-party websites, products, or services (including those of Product users and their vendors) even if they link to our Websites or Products, and we encourage you to review the applicable privacy policy of those third parties to learn how your information will be collected and used.
Please read this policy carefully to understand our policies and practices regarding your information and how we will treat it. If you do not agree with our policies and practices, your choice is not to use our Websites or Products. By accessing or using the Websites or Products, you agree to this privacy policy. This policy may change from time to time (see Changes to Our Privacy Policy). Your continued use of the Websites or Products after we make changes is deemed to be acceptance of those changes, so please check the policy periodically for updates.
Information We Collect About You and How We Collect It
We collect several types of information from and about users of our Websites and Products (including users of our Websites and Products and customers of our Products users), including information:
By which you may be personally identified, such as name, postal address, e-mail address, telephone number (“
Personal Information
”);
About your internet connection, the equipment you use to access our Websites or Products, and usage details.
We collect this information:
Directly from you when you provide it to us.
Automatically as you navigate through the Websites. Information collected automatically may include usage details, IP addresses, and information collected through cookies, web beacons, and other tracking technologies.
From third parties, for example, our business partners.
Information You Provide to Us
The information we collect on or through our Websites and Products may include:
Information that you provide by filling in forms on our Websites or provided by our Product users. This includes information provided at the time of registering to use our Websites or Product user’s merchandise, subscribing to our Products, or requesting further Products. We may also ask you for information when you report a problem with our Websites or Products, including, without limitation:
Records and copies of your correspondence (including email addresses) if you contact us.
Your responses to surveys for research purposes.
Details of transactions you carry out through our Websites or Products and of the fulfillment of your orders. You may be required to provide financial information before placing an order through our Websites or Products.
Your search queries on the Websites.
Information We Collect Through Automatic Data Collection Technologies
As you navigate through and interact with our Websites, we may use automatic data collection technologies to collect certain information about your equipment, browsing actions, and patterns, including:
Details of your visits to our Websites, including traffic data, location data, logs, and other communication data and the resources that you access and use on the Websites.
Information about your computer and internet connection, including your IP address, operating system, and browser type.
The information we collect automatically does not include Personal Information. It helps us to improve our Websites and to deliver a better and more personalized service, including by enabling us to:
Estimate our audience size and usage patterns.
Store information about your preferences, allowing us to customize our Websites according to your individual interests.
Speed up your searches.
Recognize you when you return to our Websites.
The technologies we use for this automatic data collection may include:
Cookies (or browser cookies).
A cookie is a small file placed on the hard drive of your computer. You may refuse to accept browser cookies by activating the appropriate setting on your browser. However, if you select this setting you may be unable to access certain parts of our Websites. Unless you have adjusted your browser setting so that it will refuse cookies, our system will issue cookies when you direct your browser to our Websites.
Flash Cookies.
Certain features of our Websites may use local stored objects (or Flash cookies) to collect and store information about your preferences and navigation to, from, and on our Websites. Flash cookies are not managed by the same browser settings as are used for browser cookies. For information about managing your privacy and security settings for Flash cookies, see Choices About How We Use and Disclose Your Information.
Web Beacons.
Pages of the Websites and our e-mails may contain small electronic files known as web beacons (also referred to as clear gifs, pixel tags, and single-pixel gifs) that permit the Company, for example, to count users who have visited those pages or opened an email and for other related website statistics (for example, recording the popularity of certain website content and verifying system and server integrity).
Children Under the Age of 13
Our Websites or Products are not intended for children under 13 years of age. No one under age 13 may provide any information to the Websites or Products. We do not knowingly collect Personal Information from children under 13. If you are under 13, do not use or provide any information on the Websites or through our Products. If we learn we have collected or received Personal Information from a child under 13 without verification of parental consent, we will delete that information. If you believe we might have any information from or about a child under 13, please contact us at
[email protected]
.
How We Use Your Information
We use information that we collect about you or that you provide to us, including any Personal Information:
To present our Websites and its contents to you.
To provide you with information or Products that you request from us.
To fulfill any other purpose for which you provide it.
To provide you with notices about your account/subscription, including expiration and renewal notices.
To carry out our obligations and enforce our rights arising from any contracts entered between you and us, including for billing and collection.
To notify you about changes to our Websites or any Products we offer or provide though it.
To allow you to participate in interactive features on our Websites.
In any other way we may describe when you provide the information.
For any other purpose with your consent.
We may also use your information to contact you about our Products and third-parties' goods and services that may be of interest to you. If you do not want us to use your information in this way, or if you want to change your information with us, adjust your user preferences or change your information in your account profile, or contact us as stated in Contact Information.  You may also delete your information by clicking the delete button in your account profile or contacting us as stated in Contact Information.  For more information, see Choices About How We Use and Disclose Your Information and Contact Information.
Disclosure of Your Information
We may disclose aggregated information about our users and information that does not identify any individual, without restriction.
We may disclose Personal Information that we collect, or you provide as described in this privacy policy:
To our subsidiaries and affiliates.
To contractors, service providers, and other third parties we use to support our business and who are bound by contractual obligations to keep Personal Information confidential and use it only for the purposes for which we disclose it to them.
To a buyer or other successor in the event of a merger, divestiture, restructuring, reorganization, dissolution, or other sale or transfer of some or all of Company’s assets, whether as a going concern or as part of bankruptcy, liquidation, or similar proceeding, in which Personal Information held by Company about our Websites and Product users is among the assets transferred.
For any other purpose disclosed by us when you provide the information.
With your consent.
We may also disclose your Personal Information:
To comply with any court order, law, or legal process, including to respond to any government or regulatory request.
To enforce or apply our terms of use and other agreements, including for billing and collection purposes.
If we believe disclosure is necessary or appropriate to protect the rights, property, or safety of the Company, our customers, or others. This includes exchanging information with other companies and organizations for the purposes of fraud protection and credit risk reduction.
Choices About How We Use and Disclose Your Information
We strive to provide you with choices regarding the Personal Information you provide to us. We have created mechanisms to provide you with the following control over your information:
Tracking Technologies and Advertising.
You can set your browser to refuse all or some browser cookies, or to alert you when cookies are being sent. To learn how you can manage your Flash cookie settings, visit the Flash player settings page on Adobe's website. If you disable or refuse cookies, please note that some parts of this site may then be inaccessible or not function properly.
Data Security
Unfortunately, the transmission of information via the internet is not completely secure. Although we do our best to protect your Personal Information, we cannot guarantee the security of your Personal Information transmitted to our Websites or through our Products. Any transmission of Personal Information is at your own risk. We are not responsible for circumvention of any privacy settings or security measures contained on the Websites or the Products.
Changes to Our Privacy Policy
It is our policy to post any changes we make to our privacy policy on this page. If we make material changes to how we treat our users' Personal Information, we will notify you by email to the email address specified in your account or through a notice on the Websites. The date the privacy policy was last revised is identified at the top of the page. You are responsible for ensuring we have an up- to-date active and deliverable email address for you, and for periodically visiting our Websites and this privacy policy to check for any changes.
Contact Information
To ask questions or comment about this privacy policy and our privacy practices, contact us at:
SmilePOS, LLC, PO Box 2653, Lynnwood, WA 98036 or
[email protected]
.
Accessibility Statement
SmilePOS LLC (“SmilePOS,” “we,” “our,” or “us”) is committed to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities.  We are continually improving the user experience for everyone, and applying the relevant accessibility standards.
Measures to Support Accessibility
SmilePOS takes the following measures to ensure accessibility of Smile Dining website:
Incorporate accessibility considerations into our digital resource design process.
Ensures accessibility is part of our continuous improvement process.
Follow reasonable technical practices for digital accessibility.
Conformance Status
The Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG)
defines requirements for designers and developers to improve accessibility for people with disabilities.  It defines three levels of conformance: Level A, Level AA, and Level AAA.  Smile Dining website is conformant with WCAG 2.0 level AA and partially conformant with WCAG 2.1 level AA.   Partially conformant means that some parts of the content do not fully conform to the accessibility standard.
Feedback
We welcome your feedback on the accessibility of Smile Dining website.  Please let us know if you encounter accessibility barriers:
Phone: (206) 905-9025
E-mail:
[email protected]
Compatibility with Browsers and Assistive Technology
Smile Dining website is designed to be compatible with assistive technologies and the last two versions of major browsers, including Chrome, Microsoft Edge, Safari, and Firefox.
In Internet Explorer 10, 11, and older browsers, some aspects of the website may not display optimally.  Smile Dining website is not designed for Internet Explorer 9 and earlier versions.
Technical Specifications
Accessibility of Smile Dining website relies on the following technologies to work with the particular combination of web browser and any assistive technologies or plugins installed on your computer:
HTML
CSS
JavaScript
SVG
These technologies are relied upon for conformance with the accessibility standards used.
Limitations and Alternatives
Despite our best efforts to ensure accessibility of Smile Dining website, there may be some limitations.  Please contact us as described in “Feedback” above if you encounter any issues in accessing our website.
Assessment Approach
SmilePOS assessed the accessibility of Smile Dining website by self-evaluation.
Formal complaints
If you wish to send us a formal complaint regarding accessibility accommodations of this website, please contact us as described in “Feedback” above.
Formal Approval of this Accessibility Statement
This Accessibility Statement is approved by:
SmilePOS LLC

PRIVACY STATEMENT
SECTION 1 - WHAT DO WE DO WITH YOUR INFORMATION?
When you purchase something from our store, as part of the buying and selling process, we collect the personal information you give us such as your name, address and email address.
        When you browse our store, we also automatically receive your computer’s internet protocol (IP) address in order to provide us with information that
        helps us learn about your browser and operating system.
        Email marketing (if applicable): With your permission, we may send you emails about our store, new products and other updates.
SECTION 2 - CONSENT
How do you get my consent?
When you provide us with personal information to complete a transaction, verify your credit card, place an order, arrange for a delivery or return a
        purchase, we imply that you consent to our collecting it and using it for that specific reason only.
        If we ask for your personal information for a secondary reason, like marketing, we will either ask you directly for your expressed consent, or provide
        you with an opportunity to say no.
        If after you opt-in, you change your mind, you may withdraw your consent for us to contact you, for the continued collection, use or disclosure of your
        ontinued collection, use or disclosure of your information, at anytime, by contacting us at
[email protected]
SECTION 3 - DISCLOSURE
We may disclose your personal information if we are required by law to do so or if you violate our Terms of Service.
SECTION 4 – Smile POS
Our store is hosted on Smile POS, LLC. They provide us with the online e-commerce platform that allows us to sell our products and services to you.
        Your data is stored through Smile POS’ data storage, databases and the general Smile POS application. They store your data on a secure server behind a firewall.

        Payment:

        Smile POS stores your credit card data. It is encrypted through the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI-DSS). Your purchase transaction data is stored only as long as is necessary to complete your purchase transaction. After that is complete, your purchase transaction information is deleted.
        All direct payment gateways adhere to the standards set by PCI-DSS as managed by the PCI Security Standards Council, which is a joint effort of brands like Visa, MasterCard, American Express and Discover.
        PCI-DSS requirements help ensure the secure handling of credit card information by our store and its service providers
SECTION 5 - THIRD-PARTY SERVICES
In general, the third-party providers used by us will only collect, use and disclose your information to the extent necessary to allow them to perform the services they provide to us.
        However, certain third-party service providers, such as payment gateways and other payment transaction processors, have their own privacy policies in respect to the information we are required to provide to them for your purchase-related transactions.
        For these providers, we recommend that you read their privacy policies so you can understand the manner in which your personal information will be handled by these providers.
        In particular, remember that certain providers may be located in or have facilities that are located a different jurisdiction than either you or us. So if you elect to proceed with a transaction that involves the services of a third-party service provider, then your information may become subject to the laws of the jurisdiction(s) in which that service provider or its facilities are located.
        As an example, if you are located in Canada and your transaction is processed by a payment gateway located in the United States, then your personal information used in completing that transaction may be subject to disclosure under United States legislation, including the Patriot Act.
        Once you leave our store’s website or are redirected to a third-party website or application, you are no longer governed by this Privacy Policy or our website’s Terms of Service.
Links:
        When you click on links on our store, they may direct you away from our site. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of other sites and encourage you to read their privacy statements.
SECTION 6 - SECURITY
To protect your personal information, we take reasonable precautions and follow industry best practices to make sure it is not inappropriately lost, misused, accessed, disclosed, altered or destroyed.
        If you provide us with your credit card information, the information is encrypted using secure socket layer technology (SSL) and stored with a AES-256 encryption. Although no method of transmission over the Internet or electronic storage is 100% secure, we follow all PCI-DSS requirements and implement additional generally accepted industry standards.
SECTION 7 - AGE OF CONSENT
By using this site, you represent that you are at least the age of majority in your state or province of residence, or that you are the age of majority in your state or province of residence and you have given us your consent to allow any of your minor dependents to use this site.
SECTION 8 - CHANGES TO THIS PRIVACY POLICY
We reserve the right to modify this privacy policy at any time, so please review it frequently. Changes and clarifications will take effect immediately upon their posting on the website. If we make material changes to this policy, we will notify you here that it has been updated, so that you are aware of what information we collect, how we use it, and under what circumstances, if any, we use and/or disclose it.
        If our store is acquired or merged with another company, your information may be transferred to the new owners so that we may continue to sell products to you.
QUESTIONS AND CONTACT INFORMATION
If you would like to: access, correct, amend or delete any personal information we have about you, register a complaint, or simply want more information contact our Privacy Compliance Officer at
[email protected]
Last updated on 15 March 2017

Catering Request
We serve everybody!
Delight in our Thai flavors – gluten-free options available, and we happily cater to vegans! 🌱
🍜
About Sunee Thai and Lao Kitchen
Best Thai & Lao Kitchen in Portland
We serve up sumptuous Thai and Lao fusion dishes in a relaxing environment, drawing influences from the pan-Asian spectrum to create fresh, mouth-watering food – that's why we were voted the best pad Thai in the Portland Metro area. Our chefs are experts in both Thai and Lao cuisine and use local, traditional, ...
Read more
Our Restaurant
We have designed our restaurant with simplicity and class in mind. The restaurant brings together different Thai and Lao influences to create a tranquil and relaxing environment for you to enjoy the finest fusion cuisine. Please see our photos or drop by and see how we serve up incredible food in a lovely ...
Read more
Menu & Ingredients
Our menu incorporates many of the traditional styles from across Thailand and Laos with touches of local cuisine, with our chefs using an array of exotic spices, herbs and ingredients to develop the unique taste that our restaurant is known for. The ingredients we use are a mixture of locally sourced produce and ...
Read more
